availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Elisha N. Clark (Union County, Kentucky, carpenter, machinist, and politician)

body.p: Union County, Kentucky, carpenter, machinist, and politician. New York native. Married to Lucy A. Alvey Clark in Henderson County, Kentucky, on June 14, 1849. Father of Lydia Clark, Robert Clark, Joseph Clark, Jennie Clark, Thomas Clark, and Fannie Clark. Carpenter in Henderson County in 1850. Machinist in Union County in 1860. Member of the Uniontown Board of Councilmen in Union County in 1861.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Henderson County, District 2, p. 352 B-353 A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Union County, Uniontown, p. 541.
Kentucky Marriage Records, Madison County Courthouse, Richmond, Kentucky, Henderson County Marriages, Film #001944390, p. 112.
KYR-0001-017-0195.
